TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and was serving a prison sentence at the time of the application . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , his father .
On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of membership of an illegal organisation , ORG , under LAW .
On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against ORG judgment .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE .

On DATE the applicant introduced an application with ORG . He complained under LAW that he was deprived of his right to a fair trial in that he had not been assisted by a lawyer during his questioning by the police , the public prosecutor and the magistrate .

On DATE , after an exchange of correspondence , the Registrar suggested to the parties that they should attempt to reach a friendly settlement within the meaning of LAW ( b ) of the LAW . On DATE and on DATE the Government and the applicant 's representative respectively submitted formal declarations accepting a friendly settlement of the case .
On DATE the ORG struck the case out of the list .

On DATE Law no . CARDINAL came into force , which provided , inter alia , re - opening of the criminal proceeding if ORG holds in a final judgment that a decision in criminal proceedings has violated LAW or its protocols .
On DATE the applicant requested ORG of ORG to re - open the criminal proceedings against him .
On DATE ORG of ORG dismissed the applicant 's request holding that ORG had not found a violation of LAW concerning the criminal proceedings against the applicant .
On DATE the applicant filed an objection with ORG of ORG against the decision of DATE .
On DATE the CARDINALnd Chamber of ORG dismissed the applicant 's objection on the same grounds with DATE Chamber of ORG .
LAW lists the circumstances in which “ a person convicted in a judgment that has become final may be granted a re - trial ” .
It was amended by LAW no . DATE , which added a sixth set of circumstances in which the proceedings could be re - opened :

“ where it has been held in a final judgment of ORG that a decision in criminal proceedings was given in breach of ORG or its Protocols . In such cases , an application to re - open the proceedings may be lodged within DATE of the date on which the judgment of ORG became final . ”

Law no . DATE came into force on DATE . By provisional LAW , LAW is applicable in CARDINAL sets of circumstances : where the ORG has delivered a judgment that became final before the PERSON came into force , and where the ORG delivers a final judgment on an application lodged after the PERSON came into force .
